alert.note: Alert for Washington (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 07 at 1:19PM EDT until September 07 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN WASHINGTON, NORTHEASTERN BERKELEY AND NORTHEASTERN MORGAN COUNTIES... At 119 PM EDT, While the heaviest rain has moved south of this warning area, multiple instances of flooding are reported in the Hagerstown area. Be very cautious if you need to travel, and watch low areas for flooding. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. 911 center reports. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hagerstown... Municipal Stadium... Robinwood... Fountainhead-Orchard Hills... Paramount-Long Meadow... Wilson-Conococheague... Williamsport... Saint James... Long Meadow... Halfway... Maugansville... Funkstown... Falling Waters... Fairplay... Clear Spring... Pecktonville... Big Spring... Big Pool... Middleburg... Warrenton... This includes the following Flood Prone Roads: US Highway 11 near Falling Waters Camp... Allensville Road at Back Creek... Route 11 near Fountain Head Plaza... Potomac Avenue near Magnolia Avenue... Toms Run in Clear Spring... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
